content_1: .  The German veterinary authorities and the World Organization for Animal Health (OIE) confirmed a new outbreak of low pathogenic avian influenza on a poultry farm in the state of Thuringia.  Out of 827 susceptible birds, four died after contracting the disease while the remaining 823 were destroyed to prevent the disease from spreading to other parts of the country.  The virus has been characterized as the H5 subtype of the low pathogenic avian influenza virus, but the neuraminidase subtype has not been characterized. Control measures being applied include zoning and disinfection of contaminated areas.  The source of the outbreak remains unknown. Avian Influenza in Humans
